title: What to Do If Your DHL Package Is On Hold or Delayed

steps.title: The “On Hold” message indicates your package has stopped moving.
steps.content: The “On Hold” message indicates your package has stopped moving. As your package travels from country to country, city to city, you’ll receive tracking updates that signal where your package was last scanned into a DHL facility or local courier. However, if you receive an “On Hold” message, your package has stopped its journey and is held up in a facility. [1] X Research source Generally, this can cause a delay in the package’s journey, meaning it may not arrive on its estimated delivery date. This is more common with international shipments. However, domestic shipments can be on hold, too.

steps.title: Congestion issues at the ports
steps.content: Congestion issues at the ports Due to a high volume of packages, an item may be put on hold because there isn’t enough staffing or modes of transportation to streamline the process. This is especially prevalent during the holidays when there’s a higher demand for goods.

steps.title: Disruptions in shipping routes
steps.content: Disruptions in shipping routes From road closures and inclement weather to the pandemic and strikes, plenty of external events happening worldwide can cause a package to be put on hold, especially for a global and international shipping company like DHL. In these situations, DHL has to closely follow the decisions of local authorities in the countries and cities through which packages are sent. Unfortunately, you cannot do much in these scenarios but wait for a tracking update.

steps.title: Insufficient customs documentation
steps.content: Insufficient customs documentation When ordering a package overseas, the purchaser and sender are required to provide the necessary information (the correct address, the package’s contents, and fee payments) to pass through customs successfully. If not, a package is subjected to inspection and delays. In this case, customs will contact you. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Local courier delays
steps.content: Local courier delays When DHL fulfills shipments, they’re delivered to one of the 220 postal providers the company is partnered with worldwide. For example, whether your package is delivered through USPS or FedEx depends on the merchant or online shop and the shipping services they offer you before check-out. [3] X Research source If your shipping provider is experiencing delays, this can cause your package to be placed on hold.

steps.title: Regularly check the tracking status of your shipment.
steps.content: Regularly check the tracking status of your shipment. Visit DHL.com and enter your package’s tracking number on the home page to review the last known location. Generally, it takes 3 to 14 days to deliver international packages. While it can take 3 to 8 days for domestic packages. Reviewing the tracking number may provide an updated delivery date. [4] X Research source If you’re the shipper, notify the recipient that their package is on hold and provide them with regular updates.

steps.title: Ensure all of your package’s paperwork is filed correctly.
steps.content: Ensure all of your package’s paperwork is filed correctly. If you’re mailing an international package, double-check the destination country’s customs regulations to limit delays. Every country has different paperwork requirements. Generally, you’re required to provide a commercial invoice, a letter of free sale, a bill of lading, a certificate of origin, and an export packing list. [5] X Research source Duties and taxes may be due for certain countries. Be sure to pay all the necessary fees to prevent holds. If you’re receiving an international package, ensure any fees are paid, and your address and preferred contact method are correct.

steps.title: Investigate the last known destination for insight.
steps.content: Investigate the last known destination for insight. If you can’t sit still, we don’t blame you! For peace of mind, Google the last known destination for any insight on strikes, social unrest, weather updates, and similar issues that can impact your package. If you see a massive storm or the local courier is on strike—this may indicate why your package has been delayed.

steps.title: Contact the merchant 10 days after the expected delivery date.
steps.content: Contact the merchant 10 days after the expected delivery date. Unfortunately, there’s not much you can do other than wait for a tracking update. However, if your package has still not arrived or there’s no update, contact the merchant or online shop to start an investigation for your package. [6] X Research source

steps.title: DHL packages can be on hold for a few hours or days.
steps.content: DHL packages can be on hold for a few hours or days. Many Reddit and Quora users have shared their experiences online. In many cases, their packages were put on hold for a few hours. However, it’s not uncommon for a package to remain on hold for a few days or even weeks—especially in scenarios where there are severe weather conditions or social unrest. Rest assured, your package will get to you, but you may need to wait longer than anticipated. Contact your merchant or your country’s DHL customer service. [7] X Research source

steps.title: No, don't worry—just be patient and wait for your package to arrive.
steps.content: No, don't worry—just be patient and wait for your package to arrive. Just because your package is on hold doesn’t mean it’s lost. Packages are typically placed on hold for a few hours before continuing its journey. However, if customs paperwork was incorrectly filed or the package contains something that shouldn’t be there, you may find the package was confiscated. In this scenario, you should receive a call or notification from the merchant or customs.
